title: Fix gitlab-depscan pipeline jobs that are no longer compatible with our shared configuration (broken master)
description:
### Summary

This is an error in the `gitlab-depscan` pipeline. The `check analyzer version` and `integration test` jobs [failed](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/gitlab-depscan/-/pipelines/322314256) (blocking [this](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/gitlab-depscan/-/merge_requests/21) MR) because of updates to the development templates.
1. `check analyzer version` changed the way it handles version mismatches between the changelog and the analyzer in this commit: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/commit/fbf33e069897bd9507d32083bf7b4bae8bd9aadb
1. `integration test` uses the main version of the `compare_reports.sh` which has started to check the analyzer's schema versions in this commit: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/ci-templates/-/commit/fff1f06bdac43fe4650755fa23dce619b4e23faf

To mitigate this, the ci config was updated temporarily: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/gitlab-depscan/-/commit/3d713d23783e5bcf3cd1094b5bda2ff095d9dfdc

### Steps to reproduce

Removing the mitigation above and re-running the pipeline will reproduce the failure.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Jobs fail without the mitigation above.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Jobs should succeed.

### Possible fixes

1. make schema and version checks optional when supplied a ci variable
1. add report schema for analyzer's reports and update the analyzer binary to emit a version

title: [Audit Events] Add group-level keyset pagination
description:
## Problem to solve

The Audit Events interfaces do not currently have pagination.  This is a problem when there are more than n events to display.

Pagination is not currently used because it is increasingly likely to cause a query timeout as the page number increases.

## Proposal

On the Audit Events interfaces, implement [keyset pagination](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/database/keyset_pagination.html) (which does not have the same timeout risk as traditional offset pagination).

## Related links

- Pagination was part of the HAML implementation and removed in the [conversion to a Vue implementation](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216126).

## Credit

Thanks to @ahegyi for suggesting this!

title: [Feature flag] Clean up `optimized_issuable_label_filter`
description:
## Summary

The feature flag `optimized_issuable_label_filter` was [enabled by default in 13.9](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/259719), and needs to be cleaned up (deleted).

## Clean up the feature flag

After the feature has been [deemed stable](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/product-development-flow/feature-flag-lifecycle/#including-a-feature-behind-feature-flag-in-the-final-release),
the [clean up](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up)
should be done as soon as possible to permanently enable the feature and reduce complexity in the
codebase.

- [x] Create a merge request to remove `optimized_issuable_label_filter` feature flag. Ask for review and merge it.
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase.
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository.
    - [x] Create [a changelog entry](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/#changelog).
- [x] Ensure that the above MR has been deployed to both production and canary.
      If the merge request was deployed before [the code cutoff](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/releases/#self-managed-releases-1),
      the feature can be officially announced in a release blog post.
    - [x] `/chatops run auto_deploy status <merge-commit>`
- [x] Clean up the feature flag from all environments by running these chatops command in `#production` channel:
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete optimized_issuable_label_filter --dev`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete optimized_issuable_label_filter --staging`
    - [x] `/chatops run feature delete optimized_issuable_label_filter`
- [x] Close this clean up issue.

title: Simplify metrics statuses
description:
<!-- Please complete the template below as best as you can. Make sure to check if this issue has already been raised by someone else first to avoid duplication. 

For each section below, please add screenshots or links or anything that may help visual learners understand the problem better, even if this takes you an extra minute or two this is a great help to some folks.

https://www.learning-styles-online.com/style/visual-spatial/

-->

### Problem

Simplify metrics statuses based on [Spike suggestions](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/332030#note_593053073)



### Proposal

We could simplify the metrics status.

* `active`: use active instead of `data_available` 
* remove `not_used` status if any
* remove `deprecated`: remove if any, Update documentation
* keep `removed` 
* keep `broken`. Update documentation, A metric marked as `broken` must also have the `repair_issue_url` attribute.

title: Add snowplow tracking to audit events date range segmented control
description:
### Proposal 

To help ~"group::compliance" determine how often the audit events date range segmented control is used we should add [snowplow](https://docs.gitlab.com/13.11/ee/development/snowplow/#implementing-snowplow-js-frontend-tracking) to these buttons and wait for **one milestone** to collect some data on usage.

This data could then be used to influence ~UX questions and decisions around whether to keep them or what might be done to improve their usage.

The recommended data to send to snowplow is as follows:

| Attribute | Value | Reasoning |
| --------- | ----- | --------- |
| `category` | `document.body.dataset.page` | Using this value will allow us to see which audit event page (admin, group, project) the event happened on |
| `action` | `click_date_range_button` | Follows the convention and describes the generic action taking place |
| `label` | `date_range_button_[last_7_days|last_14_days|this_month]` | Specific button that was clicked |

`value` is probably not needed. We don't need to know the range set by the button and although knowing the full search params would be useful it definitely feels like we'd be collecting excessive data.

We should use the [tracking data attributes](https://docs.gitlab.com/13.11/ee/development/snowplow/#tracking-with-data-attributes) variant so we automatically support [disabling tracking](https://docs.gitlab.com/13.11/ee/development/snowplow/#enabling-snowplow) automatically

### Implementation

~frontend :one: 

1. Add [tracking data attributes](https://docs.gitlab.com/13.11/ee/development/snowplow/#tracking-with-data-attributes) to `ee/app/assets/javascripts/audit_events/components/date_range_buttons.vue` using the snake cased title for the `label` attribute
2. Add a test to check the attributes are applied to the buttons
3. Add to the [event dictionary](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/snowplow/event_dictionary_guide.html#create-a-new-event-definition)


### Follow-up

_Add issue to review snowplow in one milestones time after implementation_

title: Spike: Add new service ping service using instrumentation classes
description:
## Current state

We have the `ServicePing::SubmitService`

- This is using `usage_data.rb` to generate service ping
- In usage_data.rb there is the possibility to use instrumentation by using [`add_metric` method](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/service_ping/#using-instrumentation-classes)
- We plan to [merge data generated using instrumentation classes to usage_data.rb ](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/338029)
- We generate complete service ping and at the end, we filter out the data considering the instance configuration. 

## Problem we want to solve

We want to use instrumentation classes for generating service ping.

## Requirements

- Set up a separate new `ServicePingService` 
- This service should use the instrumentation classes
- This should be under a feature flag `usage_data_instrumentation`
- With this service, we calculate in parallel 2 service ping payloads.
- We should compute only the metrics that are configured for a given instance.

## Questions

- Can we have a partial service ping until we migration all metrics?
- What would be the value of having 2 services in parallel? 
- When we will be able to switch?

epic.title: Migrate Service Ping to use metric instrumentation classes

title: Allow the use of Service Desk custom mailbox without a suffix
description:
Using a custom email address for Service Desk currently requires configuring a custom mailbox _and_ a custom suffix.

Without the custom suffix, the worker cannot identify the project in which to create an issue.

This is confusing for users as they can configure a custom mailbox but not use it without first going to project settings and setting a suffix. On GitLab.com, the incoming email address will be shown until the suffix is set, and will revert if the suffix is removed. This is also confusing and unexpected.

#### Proposal

Update the worker to ignore the suffix entirely (if it's not set) and find the project from the group and project id in the key. This would allow the user to customize the Service Desk email address without having to add an additional suffix if they don't wish.

title: Toggling whitespace when not logged in doesn't work
description:
Now that we save the whitespace setting to the users settings we no longer allow users to toggle this setting when they are not logged in. Furthermore actually toggling this option will throw a API error.

The minimum we should do here is at least not send any API request if the user is not logged in. But it would be nice to still support this setting without sending any API requests :shrug: 

/cc @andr3 @jboyson @phikai

title: Create a client-side solution to import the server-side rendered HAML viewers into the Vue Repository App
description:
<!-- This template is a great use for issues that are feature::additions or technical tasks for larger issues.-->

### Proposal 

As part of the Refactor of the Blob viewer, we'll be rewriting the viewers to make better use of client side solutions and lighten the load on the backend of generating complex and bloated markup.

Please check the Epic: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5531

We'll be progressively directing users to the new viewers as they are implemented.

However, we can attempt to request the HAML from the server of the old viewers and display them from within the app. 

### Objective

* Shorten the time to have all Blobs rendering quicker in the Repository -> Blob user flow
* Be able to deprecate and disable the HAML blob pages before concluding the migration of the viewers
